market_analysis.key_observation: Over the past 12 months, TQQQ has gained roughly 20–25% but sold off about 14% in the last month while implied volatility sits near the top of its 1-year range, indicating a bullish yet very high-volatility tech-led environment.

strategy_logic.entry_condition: On daily data for TQQQ, open a long position at bar t when ALL of the following are true using indicator values at bar t: (1) Close[t] > SMA50[t] (price is above its 50-day simple moving average, indicating an intermediate-term uptrend); (2) Close[t-1] < LowerBB20_2[t-1] AND Close[t] > LowerBB20_2[t] (today the close has crossed back above the lower Bollinger Band after closing below it yesterday, i.e., a sharp pullback reverting back into the band within the uptrend); (3) RSI14[t] >= 35 AND RSI14[t] <= 55 (RSI is in a mildly oversold-to-neutral range, confirming a pullback but avoiding deeply oversold breakdowns).
strategy_logic.exit_condition: Close the long position at bar t when ANY of the following are true: (1) Close[t] < SMA50[t] (price closes back below the 50-day SMA, signaling a potential end to the intermediate uptrend); (2) RSI14[t] >= 70 (RSI reaches traditional overbought territory, suggesting exhaustion of the swing); (3) Close[t-1] > MiddleBB20_2[t-1] AND Close[t] < MiddleBB20_2[t] (the close crosses down through the middle Bollinger Band, equivalent to a 20-day SMA breakdown in short-term momentum).

reasoning: TQQQ is a 3× leveraged Nasdaq-100 ETF that has produced strong double-digit 1-year returns but with extremely high realized and implied volatility, including a sharp one-month drawdown, so a dip-buying approach that only participates when price is in an established uptrend (Close > SMA50) and has just rebounded from the lower Bollinger Band helps exploit bullish mean-reversion swings while avoiding prolonged downtrends; pairing this with RSI-based confirmation and relatively tight fixed 10% stop-loss and 25% take-profit levels is appropriate for a vehicle whose triple leverage amplifies both upside moves and drawdowns.
